channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Belgium rejects EU plan to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine
item.description: Belgium on Wednesday rejected a plan to use frozen Russian assets to help prop up Ukraine's economy and war effort over the next two years, saying tha...

item.title: One year on from martial law crisis, South Korea celebrates its democracy's resilience
item.description: One year on from failed presidential power grab, South Korea celebrates its resilient democracy, and tries to heal deep political divisions.

item.title: Dems seek to limit who can be immigration judges. And, the GOP wins House election
item.description: Democrats seek to limit who can serve as immigration judges amid layoffs from the administration. And, Republican Matt Van Epps narrowly wins a specia...

item.title: Doctors warn delaying hepatitis B shot for newborns could revive a deadly threat
item.description: As RFK Jr.'s new vaccine panel ponders changing the hepatitis B vaccination schedule, some doctors recall past patients, including children, who died ...

item.title: A Palestinian convicted in bombing plot is now an award-winning novelist, and free
item.description: Bassem Khandaqji entered prison 21 years ago for plotting a deadly bombing in Israel. He left prison as an award-winning novelist.

item.title: Israel says Rafah crossing to open soon to let Palestinians leave Gaza via Egypt
item.description: Egypt denies it is co-ordinating with Israel to reopen the crossing, insisting that passage should be in both directions.

item.title: What has Trump said about seeking a third term?
item.description: President Trump has previously suggested he's eyeing ways to run again for president. But he downplayed talk of a third term in his latest comments.

item.title: Trump administration launches immigration crackdown in New Orleans
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security has launched operation "Catahoula Crunch" to crackdown on immigration in New Orleans, Louisiana. CBS News' Kati We...

item.title: Trump targets Minnesotaâ€™s Somali community with harsh words and policies
What latest Ukraine talks reveal about Putin's state of mind
item.description: Russia's president looks determined to continue his war in Ukraine - even as the country's economic problems grow.

item.title: Trump says he does not want Somalis in US as ICE plans Minnesota operation
item.description: The president says the US will "go the wrong way if we keep taking in garbage into our country".

item.title: Production halted at Chinese factory making 'childlike' sex dolls
item.description: The issue is in the spotlight after Shein announced a global ban on the sale of sex dolls with a childlike appearance.

item.title: Hong Kong orders removal of scaffolding mesh after deadly blaze
item.description: Investigations continue into a fire last week at the Wang Fuk Court housing complex, which killed at least 159 people.

item.title: Trump pardoning Rep. Henry Cuellar, a Texas Democrat facing bribery charges
item.description: Texas Democratic Rep. Henry Cuellar was indicted last year on more than a dozen federal charges.

item.title: Raccoon passes out on Virginia liquor store bathroom floor after drunken rampage
item.description: An employee at the Ashland, Virginia, area liquor store on Saturday found the trash panda passed out on the bathroom floor at the end of his drunken e...

item.title: Raccoon breaks into liquor store, gets drunk and passes out
item.description: A raccoon broke into a Virginia liquor store and got into some of its liquor. CBS News' Errol Barnett reports.

item.title: Trump-backed Republican Matt Van Epps wins US House special election in Tennessee
Federal authorities plan operation in Minnesota focusing on Somali immigrants, AP source says
item.description: Federal authorities are preparing an immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota, focusing on Somali immigrants living unlawfully in the U.S.
